# Draft:Nabataean-Seleucid War

----
Alexander Jannaeus
| casualties1       = Unknown but low casualties
| casualties2       = High causalities
| caption           = A map during the war
| date              = 84-82 BCE
}}
The Nabatean-Seleucid War was a conflict from 84-82 BCE, lasting approxemitly 2 or less years, the conflict started when Antiochus XII Dionysusof the Seleucid Empire launched a few campaign's against the Nabataean Kingdom to regain dominance over areas like Levant.
The war later ended at the Battle of Cana in a big win for the  Nabataean kingdom, and later the beheading of King Antiochus XII Dionysus, the Nabatean gained extra wealth and land, while the Seleucid Empire suffered major damage, as they have already suffered through civil wars and rising tensions.
Other belligerents include some Arab tribes on the Nabatean side and the Hasmonean dynasty on the Seleucid side, both the Hasmonean dynasty and the Seleucid Empire failed at capturing certain areas
See also
* Battle of Cana
* Battle of Gadara
Reference
* 1.Atkinson, Kenneth (2016). A History of the Hasmonean State: Josephus and Beyond. T&T Clark Jewish and Christian Texts. Vol. 23. Bloomsbury Publishing. p. 129. ISBN 978-0-567-66903-2.
* 2.Jane, Taylor (2001). Petra and the Lost Kingdom of the Nabataeans. London, United Kingdom: I.B.Tauris. Retrieved 16 July 2016.
* 3.Warwick Ball (10 June 2016). Rome in the East: The Transformation of an Empire.  Routledge. p. 65. Retrieved 11 July 2016.
* 4.Glen Warren Bowersock (1994). Roman Arabia. Harvard University Press. pp. 24–25. Retrieved 11 July 2016.
